item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, February 4, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Nvidia open-source nanite: continuous level of detail (LOD) mesh library (44 points | 8 comments)
2. Microsoft Is Dead (2007) (29 points | 10 comments)
3. Alibaba/T-HEAD's Xuantie C910 (182 points | 45 comments)
4. Mitochondria as you've never seen them (158 points | 32 comments)
5. OWASP Non-Human Identities Top 10 (103 points | 22 comments)
6. The Video Game History Foundation library opens in early access (228 points | 39 comments)
7. Nango (Product Integrations Platform) Is Hiring a Senior Full-Stack Engineer ( | hide)
8. Popular Linux orgs Freedesktop and Alpine Linux are scrambling for new webhost (39 points | 1 comment)
9. Httptap: View HTTP/HTTPS requests made by any Linux program (555 points | 124 comments)
10. I Use Cline for AI Engineering (23 points | 5 comments)
11. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (February 2025) (428 points | 420 comments)
12. AMD adds RF-sampling data converters to Versal adaptive SoCs (18 points | 5 comments)
13. AI systems with 'unacceptable risk' are now banned in the EU (313 points | 268 comments)
14. Compiling Java into native binaries with Graal and Mill (121 points | 66 comments)
15. AMD: Microcode Signature Verification Vulnerability (243 points | 98 comments)
16. The Forbidden Garden of Leningrad: Science and Sacrifice in a City Under Siege (5 points | 1 comment)
17. The U.S. needs a shipbuilding revolution (81 points | 93 comments)
18. "A computer can never be held accountable" (208 points | 153 comments)
19. Backblaze seemingly does not support files greater than 1 TB (48 points | 49 comments)
20. Ask HN: Who wants to be hired? (February 2025) (147 points | 364 comments)
21. Open Euro LLM: Open LLMs for Transparent AI in Europe (267 points | 201 comments)
22. I Wrote a WebAssembly VM in C (291 points | 67 comments)
23. ArXiv LaTeX Cleaner: Clean the LaTeX code of your paper to submit to ArXiv (80 points | 16 comments)
24. Show HN: I convert videos to printed flipbooks for living (433 points | 104 comments)
25. The Final Frontier with Steve Jurvetson (5 points | discuss)
26. Macintosh Allegro Common Lisp (76 points | 15 comments)
27. Order Declassifying JFK and MLK Assassination Records [pdf] (239 points | 180 comments)
28. Spotted hyena found in Egypt for the first time in 5k years (49 points | 24 comments)
29. No-Panic Rust: A Nice Technique for Systems Programming (152 points | 95 comments)
30. Constitutional Classifiers: Defending against universal jailbreaks (75 points | 55 comments)
